metadata.title: CVE-2006-20001 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A carefully crafted If: request header can cause a memory read, or write ofa single zero byte, in a pool (heap) memory location beyond the headervalue sent. This could cause the process to crash. This issue affectsApache HTTP Server 2.4.54 and earlier.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2006-20001` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.26
apache2-bin - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.26
apache2-data - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.26
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.26
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.26
apache2-utils - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.26
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.29-1ubuntu4.26').
